def_en: If something is deadly, it is likely or able to cause someone's death, or has already caused someone's death.

def_cn: 为达目的不择手段的;阴险毒辣的;冷酷无情的
def_en: If you describe a person or their behaviour as deadly, you mean that they will do or say anything to get what they want, without caring about other people.

def_cn: 非常乏味的;极其无聊的
def_en: If you describe someone or something as deadly, you mean that you think they are very dull and boring.

def_cn: (尤用于强调令人不快或不受欢迎的特质) 极其，非常
def_en: You can use deadly to emphasize that something has a particular quality, especially an unpleasant or undesirable quality.
A deadly situation has unpleasant or dangerous consequences.

def_cn: (敌人或对手)殊死的，不共戴天的
def_en: Deadly enemies or rivals fight or compete with each other in a very aggressive way.

def_cn: (运动员或其动作）极富技巧性的，极难防御的
def_en: In sport, deadly players and actions are extremely skilful and successful.
